result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaun D Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 1 Day Credit if probation is ever revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Total court costs due during term of sentence.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.    

Court orders restitution in the amount of $2,659.96. Court finds restitution has been paid.

Defendant to undergo financial counseling as determined appropriate by the Department.
Defendant to submit to DNA sample.
Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaun D Wagner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shaun D Wagner in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.  Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shaun D Wagner in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requesting dispositional hearing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on December 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shaun D Wagner in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requeting adjournment for possible plea/sentencing.  Further proceedings scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on November 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shaun D Wagner in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver form filed. Court examines defendant, accepts said waiver and binds matter over for trial. State informs. Counsel waives reading and enters a not guilty plea.  Further proceedings scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shaun Wagner in court, in custody from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz. Attorney Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Boaz appearing as a friend of the court. Defendant qualifies for Public Defender but may want to retain private counsel. Counsel waives reading. Court finds probable cause. State requests $1,000 signature bond with conditions. Counsel requesting status of preliminary hearing, waiving time limits. Court orders $1,000 signature bond with conditions: No contact with business Dr. Comfort and No contact with J.D. Status hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 1:15 pm.
